description: From Latin inhaerēre, present active infinitive of inhaereō (“stick in, stick to, inhere to”), from in (“in”) + haereō (“stick”); see hesitate. Compare adhere, cohere.

verbs.description: inhere (third-person singular simple present inheres, present participle inhering, simple past and past participle inhered)

entries.meaning: to be inherent; to be an essential or intrinsic part of; to be fixed or permanently incorporated with something
